contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Yavoriv | image_skyline = | image_caption = | settlement_type = City | image_shield = Yavoriv gerb.gif| | shield_size = 140px | pushpin_map = Ukraine | pushpin_label_position = bottom | coordinates_region = UA | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{UKR}} | subdivision_type1 = Province | subdivision_name1 = [[File:Flag of Lviv Oblast.png|22px|border]] [[Lviv Oblast]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Raion]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Yavorivskyi Raion]] | subdivision_type3 = | subdivision_name3 = | leader_title = | leader_name = | established_title = Founded | established_date = 14<small><sup>th</sup></small> century | established_title2= [[Magdeburg rights|Magdeburg law]] | established_date2 = 1569 | area_total_km2 = 23.35 | population_as_of = 2001 | population_total = 13,285 | population_density_km2 = 569.050 | timezone = EET | utc_offset = +2 | timezone_DST = EEST | utc_offset_DST = +3 | elevation_m = 296 | latd = 49 | latm = 56 | lats = 49 | latNS = N | longd = 23 | longm = 23 | longs = 35 | longEW = E | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 81000 | area_code = +380-3259 | blank_name = | blank_info = | website = }} '''Yavoriv''' ({{lang-uk|Яворів}}; {{lang-pl|Jaworów}}) is a [[city]] located in the [[Lviv Oblast]] ([[Oblast|province]]) of western [[Ukraine]]. It is the [[Capital city|administrative center]] of the [[Yavoriv Raion]] and rests approximately 50 km west of the oblast capital, [[Lviv]]. The current estimated population is around 13,500 (as of 2001). Not far from it is the watering-place of Shklo with sulphur springs. The town was first mentioned in written documents in 1376, when it belonged to the Duke of [[Opava]] and [[Raciborz]], Waclaw. It received [[Magdeburg rights]] in 1569, from King [[Zygmunt III August]]. It was a favorite residence of king [[John III Sobieski]], who there received the congratulations from the Pope on his [[Battle of Vienna|success against the Turks at Vienna]] (1683). Until the [[Partitions of Poland]], Yavoriv, or Jaworow, was an important center of commerce, located along main merchant route from [[Jaroslaw]] to [[Lwow]]. In 1772 it was annexed by the [[Habsburg Empire]], as part of Austrian [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]], where it remained until late 1918. In Galicia, it was the seat of a county, with the population of almost 11,000 (Jews, Poles, Ukrainians, Czechs). In the immediate post-[[World War One]] period, the area of Jaworow witnessed Polish - Ukrainian fighting (see [[Polish-Ukrainian War]]). Here in 1919, authorities of the [[West Ukrainian People's Republic]] murdered 17 Polish prisoners, whom they accused of plotting against the government. After the war, the town became part of the [[Second Polish Republic]], where it remained until the September 1939 [[Invasion of Poland]]. Among notable people born here are [[Wladyslaw Langner]] (General of the [[Polish Army]]), Stanislaw Nowakowski ([[List of Presidents of the Polish Scouting and Guiding Association|president of the Polish Scouting and Guiding Association]]), and mathematician [[Wawrzyniec Zmurko]]. ==International relations== {{See also|List of twin towns and sister cities in Ukraine}} ===Twin towns — Sister cities=== Yavoriv is [[town twinning|twinned]] with: {| class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:100%; background:#FFFFEF; float:left;" |- !
